summary: Blocker analysis complete. Quotient representative mismatch is fundamental to Antisymmetrization approach -- phi membership cannot propagate between equivalent representatives (only G-formulas do via GContent). Recommended resolution: Option 1 (generalize BFMCS from LinearOrder to Preorder, use CanonicalReachable directly). LinearOrder is never used in proofs (only type constraints). Changing forward_G/backward_H from strict (<) to reflexive (<=) enables working with CanonicalReachable's natural Preorder, eliminating the quotient entirely and making forward_F/backward_P trivially provable.

artifacts.summary: Blocker analysis and resolution path evaluation: quotient representative mismatch, LinearOrder usage audit, four options evaluated, Option 1 (Preorder generalization) recommended

key_findings.blocker_cause: Antisymmetrization quotient representative loses individual formula membership (only GContent preserved)
key_findings.recommended_option: Option 1: Generalize BFMCS to Preorder, work with CanonicalReachable directly
key_findings.enabling_change: Change BFMCS.forward_G from t < t' to t <= t' and backward_H similarly
